hand, among non-overweight women, Diouf et al. [82] established that preconception weight loss is positively 
associated with giving birth to small-for-gestational-age infants. 
Epidemiological studies in humans suggest that obesity during pregnancy is associated with pregnancy-related 
complications [32], including: gestational hypertension; pre-eclampsia; gestational diabetes mellitus  
(GDM) [83,84]; postpartum haemorrhage and oxidative stress [83]; low birth weight [74
